name: Zero Frame
description:
Quickly create, wrap layers, or insert zero frames into an Auto Layout. Zero Frame provides a painless experience for working with zero frames in Figma.


What is a Zero Frame?

A zero frame is a frame with either zero height or width. It occupies no space on the canvas but can contain and position layers within it.


Why use a Zero Frame?

Zero frames can be used to add layers to AutoLayout with absolute positioning, i.e. they are not affected by the stacking order of other layers, but still retain the auto-sizing behavior of AutoLayout. It can be used in a number of ways, some of which are described in this great talk from Figma Config 2021 - Pushing Figma to its limits with Chudo, Andrei, Gleb, Vitalii, Shuaiqi.


Open Source

Zero Frame is open source and contributions are welcome.
